meanings.sent1: Her constant disfavor towards the new student made him feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's disfavor towards late assignments was well-known among the students.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed its disfavor for the new food by refusing to eat it.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead seemed to cast a disfavor over the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The disfavor in her eyes was evident as she watched him break the vase.

meanings.definition: to regard or treat with disapproval or dislike
meanings.sent1: She would often disfavor any form of cheating in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: He tends to disfavor loud music late at night.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to disfavor the mailman, barking every time he approached.
meanings.sent4: The politician's actions seemed to disfavor the opposing party.
meanings.sent5: The judge's stern look seemed to disfavor the defendant's plea.

meanings.sent1: The team faced disfavor from the coach after their poor performance.
meanings.sent2: The disfavor of the audience was evident as they left the theater early.
meanings.sent3: The disfavor of the weather caused the outdoor event to be canceled.
meanings.sent4: The disfavor of the gods was believed to bring misfortune to the village.
meanings.sent5: The disfavor of the king led to the exile of the nobleman.
